title: World War Technology
description: This is a Foundry VTT module built off of the WWT addon by EldritchDeam, designed for PF2e. The Scribe page for further information can be found here: World War Tech

automatic-3.label: Automatic 3
automatic-3.description: Automatic weapons are accompanied by a number, this is the amount of ammunition consumed by using the Automatic Fire Activity which you have access to when using an automatic weapon.

automatic-8.label: Automatic 8
automatic-8.description: Automatic weapons are accompanied by a number, this is the amount of ammunition consumed by using the Automatic Fire Activity which you have access to when using an automatic weapon.

automatic-10.label: Automatic 10
automatic-10.description: Automatic weapons are accompanied by a number, this is the amount of ammunition consumed by using the Automatic Fire Activity which you have access to when using an automatic weapon.

choke-1.label: Choke 1
choke-1.description: Scatter weapons with the Choke trait trade a smaller area of splash damage but increase the splash damage by the number that accompanies the choke trait.

choke-2.label: Choke 2
choke-2.description: Scatter weapons with the Choke trait trade a smaller area of splash damage but increase the splash damage by the number that accompanies the choke trait.

Powered-2-s.label: Powered 2 S
Powered-2-s.description: Powered is always accompanied by a damage type and a value (eg. powered 1 S). You can load a powered weapon with an energy cell). You gain access to the Power Weapon action when you wield a powered weapon. Replacing the energy cell takes three interact actions that do not need to be consecutive (One to remove the spent cell, one to draw a new cell, and a third to load the new cell)

semi-auto.label: Semi-Auto
semi-auto.description: Semi-auto weapons function like Capacity weapons, except they automatically switch to the next chamber or barrel after you fire the weapon instead of requiring an action.

sticky.label: Sticky
sticky.description: Weapons with the sticky trait deal persistent damage matching the type they deal on a strike equal to 1 for every damage die the weapon has on a critical hit. when the weapon becomes +3 the persistent damage increases to 2 per weapon damage die.

capacity-6.label: Capacity 6
capacity-6.description: This trait denotes the amount in Light Bult that can be stored.

capacity-7.label: Capacity 7
capacity-7.description: This trait denotes the amount in Light Bult that can be stored.

volley-10.label: Volley 10 ft.
volley-10.description: This ranged weapon is less effective at close distances. Your attacks against targets that are at a distance within the range listed take a -2 penalty.

capacity-6.label: Capacity 6
capacity-6.description: This trait denotes the amount in Light Bult that can be stored.

capacity-7.label: Capacity 7
capacity-7.description: This trait denotes the amount in Light Bult that can be stored.

cannister.label: Cannister
cannister.description: Some weapons use gasses or fluids stored in canisters, these canisters are heavy, weighing 1 bulk and housing a number of shots listed in their ammo entry. They tend to be filled with alchemical fluids and may have the alchemical trait. these otherwise count as a magazine for the repeating trait.

cartridge.label: Cartridge
cartridge.description: Cartridge ammunition is sealed in a casing (typically made of metal), filled with gunpowder, and capped with the projectile to be fired, Cartridge casings need to be removed or ejected before a new round of ammunition can be placed in the weapon, this is generally done as part of reloading. Due to the advanced compact nature of the ammunition, two Cartridge rounds can be loaded into a weapon with a single reload interact action. Weapons with magazines automatically eject their casings. Cartridges are capable of being fired underwater and are not ruined by exposure to water, but long-term exposure may cause them to leak.

grenade.label: Grenade
grenade.description: Items with this trait have a short delay before exploding in a burst, they detonate at the beginning of the next turn of the creature that activated it, therefore being unable to place its area in the air (except when falling great distances). An additional action with the concentrate trait can be used to activate the grenade, when you do so, the grenade explodes sooner, allowing you to place its center point in the air and causing it to detonate immediately upon reaching its target.

skybomb.label: Skybomb
skybomb.description: skybombs are specially bundled or built explosives and ordinances meant to be dropped from great height to the ground where the great force of falling detonates them. Normal bumps and dings will not detonate a skybomb, though breaking the skybomb and then striking its detonator or dealing fire damage will cause them to explode.
